definition: mother-of-pearl (used in ornamentation and in TCM)

sentences.english: Those belonging to the wealthy were often richly inlaid with mother of pearl.
sentences.chinese: 那些有钱人家穿的通常会奢华的镶上珍珠母。

sentences.english: Only the mother-of-pearl and plastic buttons are bought.
sentences.chinese: 唯一珍珠母和塑料按钮被买。

sentences.english: Zhen zhu mu (shells) are being used as zhen zhu (pearls) clinically.
sentences.chinese: 临床上常以珍珠母代替珍珠使用。

sentences.english: Mother-of-pearl, metal, or ceramics are other types of button for Mens suit.
sentences.chinese: 珍珠母，金属，陶瓷也是西装纽扣的一些类型。

definition: the bulb of the fritillary (Fritillaria thunbergii)
the larva of silkworm with batrytis
dwarf lilyturf (Ophiopogon japonicus), its tuber used in TCM
root bark of the peony tree (used in TCM)
Ningpo figwort (Scrophularia ningpoensis)/root of Ningpo figwort (used in TCM)
root of herbaceous peony (Paeonia lactiflora), used in TCM
common water plantain (Alisma plantago-aquatica)/water plantain rhizome (used in TCM)
